verses.text: 拿單指摘大衛，大衛認罪耶和華差派拿單去見大衛。於是拿單來到大衛那裡，對他說：「在一座城裡有兩個人，一個富有，一個貧窮。

words.note: A verb-object compound meaning 'to point out and expose faults'.
A verb-object compound.
The Hebrew name for God.

verses.text: 那富有的有極多牛羊，

words.note: Turns the adjective '富有' into a noun phrase 'the wealthy one'.

verses.text: 那貧窮的除了買來養的一隻母羊羔以外，甚麼也沒有。那小羊在他家裡和他的兒女一同長大，小羊吃他的食物，喝他杯中的飲料，睡在他的懷裡，就像他的女兒一樣。

words.note: Turns the adjective '貧窮' into a noun phrase 'the poor one'.
Specifically refers to a female lamb.
Often used with '除了'.
Used here to emphasize the negativity: 'not even anything'.

verses.text: 有一個旅客來到富翁那裡，他捨不得從自己的牛群羊群中取一頭出來，款待到他那裡來的旅客，卻取了那窮人的母羊羔，款待到他那裡來的客人。」

words.note: Specifically refers to a female lamb.

verses.text: 大衛就非常惱怒那人，對拿單說：「我指著永活的耶和華起誓，作這事的人該死。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
A verb-object compound.
Turns '作這事' into 'the one who does this thing'.

verses.text: 他必須四倍賠償這羊羔，因為他作了這事，又因他沒有憐憫的心。」

words.note: Often used in religious contexts.

verses.text: 拿單對大衛說：「你就是那人！耶和華以色列的 神這樣說：『我膏立了你作以色列的王，把你從掃羅的手裡救了出來，

words.note: A transliteration of the Hebrew divine name.
The leading space often used in Chinese Bibles to emphasize 'God' as a proper noun.
Indicates the following noun is the direct object of the verb.

verses.text: 把你主人的家賜給你，把你主人的妻妾交在你懷裡，又把以色列和猶大家賜給你。你若是還以為太少，我還可以多多加給你。

words.note: Refers to the practice of polygamy, common in ancient times.

verses.text: 你為甚麼藐視耶和華的話，行他看為惡的事呢？你用刀擊殺了赫人烏利亞，娶了他的妻子作你的妻子，你藉著亞捫人的刀殺了烏利亞。

words.note: Often used in moral or religious contexts.
More formal or severe than just '殺'.

verses.text: 所以，從今以後，刀劍必不離開你的家，因為你藐視了我，娶了赫人烏利亞的妻子作你的妻子。』

words.note: Often used metaphorically for conflict or war in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 耶和華這樣說：『看哪！我必從你家中興起禍患攻擊你；我要在你的眼前把你的妃嬪拿去賜給別人。他要在光天化日之下與她們同床。

words.note: A particle used to draw attention, like 'Lo!' or 'Behold!'
Often used for raising up individuals or calamities in biblical texts.
Frequently used in biblical contexts referring to divine judgment or suffering.
Term for royal concubines, common in historical and biblical texts.
Formal term for giving, common in religious and imperial contexts.
An idiom referring to full daylight, openly and publicly.
Classic literary particle, similar to 'de' (的).

verses.text: 你在暗中行了這事，我卻要在所有以色列人面前，在光天化日之下行這事報應你。』」

words.note: An idiom referring to full daylight, openly and publicly.
Classic literary particle, similar to 'de' (的).
Often implies divine retribution or karmic repayment.

verses.text: 大衛對拿單說：「我得罪了耶和華了。」拿單對大衛說：「耶和華已經除去了你的罪，你必不至於死。

words.note: 得罪 (dézuì) means to offend or sin against someone/God.
Implies a certainty that something will not reach a certain outcome.

verses.text: 只是因為你作了這事，使耶和華的仇敵大得褻瀆的機會，所以你所生的兒子必定死。」

words.note: Common in biblical narratives for adversaries, especially spiritual or national ones.
A formal term for sacrilege or irreverence towards the sacred.
Used to form a nominal phrase, often indicating a passive or resultative action.

verses.text: 於是拿單回自己的家去了。耶和華擊打烏利亞的妻子給大衛所生的孩子，他就害了重病。

words.note: Often used in biblical texts for divine judgment or punishment.
Used to form a nominal phrase, often indicating a passive or resultative action.
Used in the sense of 'to suffer from' or 'to contract' an illness.

verses.text: 大衛的兒子病逝大衛為那孩子懇求 神，並且禁食。他進房裡去，終夜躺在地上。

words.note: A formal term for dying from sickness.
Implies a deep, heartfelt request.
The leading space is a reverent mark for God's name.
A more literary or formal way to say 'all night'.

verses.text: 他家中的老侍從站在他旁邊，要把他從地上扶起來，他卻不肯，也不與他們一起吃飯。

words.note: Refers to a retinue or personal attendants.

words.definition: to want to, be about to

words.note: Introduces the object of a verb before the verb.
More formal than '跟' (gēn).

verses.text: 到了第七天，孩子死了。大衛的臣僕不敢告訴他孩子死了，因為他們說：「看哪，孩子還活著的時候，我們勸他，他尚且不聽我們的話。現在我們怎麼能告訴他孩子已經死了呢？他會傷心欲絕的。」

words.note: Indicates completion or change of state.
Indicates completion or change of state.
Refers to official servants or subordinates in a court.
Indicates completion or change of state.
An exclamation used to draw attention, common in biblical texts.
Connects a descriptive clause to a noun.
Indicates 'even in that case' or 'still'.
Indicates completion or change of state.
Softens the question, implies a rhetorical or pondering tone.
An idiom describing extreme sorrow, to the point of collapse.
Indicates affirmation or a strong prediction.

verses.text: 大衛看見他的臣僕彼此低聲耳語，就知道孩子已經死了。他問臣僕說：「孩子死了嗎？」他們回答：「死了！」

words.note: Refers to official servants or subordinates in a court.
Literally 'low voice ear whisper'.
Indicates completion or change of state.
Refers to official servants or subordinates in a court.
Indicates completion or change of state.
Forms a yes/no question.
Indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 於是大衛從地上起來，洗澡，抹膏，更換衣服，進耶和華的殿去敬拜，然後回到自己的宮裡去，吩咐人給他擺上飯，他就吃了。

words.note: Often introduces a result or next action.
Refers to the religious practice of applying oil.
The Hebrew name for God.
Refers to a grand building, often a temple or royal hall.
Refers to a royal residence.
Indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 臣僕問他：「你為甚麼這樣作呢？孩子還活著的時候，你為他禁食哭泣；孩子死了，你倒起來吃飯！」
他回答：「孩子還活著的時候，我禁食哭泣，因為我想：『也許耶和華憐憫我，讓孩子可以活著。』

words.note: A transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.

verses.text: 現在他死了，我為甚麼還要禁食呢？我還能使他回來嗎？我要到他那裡去，他卻不能回到我這裡來。」
所羅門出生大衛安慰他的妻子拔示巴，進到她那裡去，與她同睡。她生了一個兒子，大衛給他起名叫所羅門；耶和華也喜愛他，

words.note: Functions as a contextual introductory phrase for the verse.
A transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.

verses.text: 就差派拿單先知去，照著耶和華的吩咐，給他起名叫耶底底亞。

words.note: A transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.

verses.text: 約押攻取拉巴那時，約押正在攻打亞捫人的拉巴，攻取了王城。

words.note: Abbreviation for '1 Chronicles'

verses.text: 約押派遣使者去見大衛，說：「我攻打拉巴，已經攻取了水城。

words.note: Refers to the part of the city containing the water supply.

verses.text: 現在，請你聚集其餘的人民，安營攻打這城，把城攻取；免得我攻取了這城，人就以我的名字來叫這城。」

words.note: Verb-object compound
Introduces the direct object before the verb

verses.text: 於是大衛聚集所有的人民，向拉巴進軍；攻打那城，把它攻取了。

words.note: Verb-object compound
Introduces the direct object before the verb

verses.text: 大衛從他們的王的頭上奪取了王冠。王冠的金子重三十五公斤，上面嵌有寶石，人把這冠冕戴在大衛的頭上。大衛又從這城裡帶走了許多戰利品，

words.note: Locative suffix 上 indicating position
Metric unit, literally 'public catty'
Here implies 'someone' or 'they'
Introduces the direct object before the verb
A more formal or literary term for 'crown' than 王冠
Locative suffix 上 indicating position
Locative suffix 裡 indicating inside

verses.text: 又把那城裡的人民帶出去，使他們用鋸子、鐵耙、鐵斧作工，或使他們在磚窯服役。大衛對待亞捫各城的居民都是這樣。後來，大衛和眾人都回耶路撒冷去了。

words.note: Here as directional complement to 帶 (bring out).
Refers to compulsory or military service.
Refers to the Ammonite people or kingdom.
Often refers to 'the crowd' in religious contexts.
Indicates completion or change of state.
